description.narrative: The Fund is expected to have significant development impact in the following areas: -- encouraging economic and private sector development by providing much needed equity capital and management advice for SMEs which in return will promote job creation; -- implementing best-practice corporate governance and E&S standards at the Fund and investee level; and -- supporting regional integration.

The project consists of an IFC equity investment of up to $10 million or a maximum of 20% of total capital commitments in CoreCo Central America Fund I, L.P. (CCAF I or the Fund), a private equity fund that will invest in small- and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) in Central America. With a target size of $65 million, the Fund will focus on underserved sectors with high growth rates, such as healthcare, IT, retail, financial and business services. The Fund will invest in 8-12 regional services-based businesses with an investment allocation of $1 million to $5 million per company. Managed by CoreCo Management, Inc., a well-qualified fund management with presence and business networks across Central America, the fund management team sees an opportunity in the region considering: (i) there is an underserved private equity market in the region with growing demand; (ii) the region is attractive in terms of size and consumption; and (iii) there is a favorable competitive landscape where strong demand for independent capital with good corporate governance and financial standards are required. The Funds investment thesis and exit strategy anticipate regionalization and cross-border exits.

participating-org.narrative: CoreCo Central America I Limited Partnership

mailing-address.narrative: Alex von der Goltz 14 Calle 3-51 Zona 10, Oficina 504 Edificio Murano Center Guatemala City, Guatemala T: +502 2229-1324 T: +1 305 704-3344 mailto:agoltz.ifc@corecoholding.com http://www.corecoholding.com/CC/Coreco.html Roberto Ponce and William Muecke 200 Mts Norte Escuela Espan~a San Antonio de Bele´n, Heredia Costa Rica T: +506 8853-3338 T: +506 8704-5465 Miami Office (Mail & Parcels) 2250 S.W. 3rd Ave, Suite 301 Miami, FL 33129 T: +1 305 704 3344 F: +1 305 704 3334

name.narrative: Both the Fund and the Fund Manager are registered in Delaware (U.S.), with the Fund registered as a limited partnership while the Fund Manager is registered as a company. The Fund Manager is co-headquartered and maintains offices in Costa Rica and Guatemala, as well as a satellite U.S. office in Miami. The fund management staff and their extended network of professional advisors have a presence in Mexico, El Salvador, Honduras, Nicaragua, Panama and Colombia, which gives the Fund coverage of all countries within the target regions.
